The Receptionist will be responsible for greeting clients and guests, answering phones in a professional manner, and providing administrative support to the office when needed. ORGANIZATIONAL BACKGROUND
Sinai Health System (SHS) is one the largest private safety net healthcare systems in Illinois. SHS includes Mount Sinai Hospital, Schwab Rehabilitation Hospital, Holy Cross Hospital, and 18 outpatient clinics. The system employs approximately 4,000 individuals and serves a geographic area of 1.5 million people on Chicago’s West and Southwest sides.
Through community programs delivered by Sinai Community Institute and research conducted by epidemiologists at Sinai Urban Health Institute, SHS has one of the broadest ranges of community services of any health system in the country and is on a trajectory to become the national model for urban healthcare.
We are continuing to building a new development enterprise and looking for creative, collaborative leaders who are passionate about using their skills and abilities to make a difference in the lives of those living is some of Chicago’s most underserved communities. If you are looking for an opportunity to use your knowledge and experience to help shape Chicago’s future and change individual’s lives, we would love to hear from you.
GENERAL SUMMARY:
Receives callers, determines nature of business, and directs callers to destination. 
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND DUTIES
Answers telephones, takes and delivers clear, accurate and timely messages; and screens calls as necessary.
Performs receptionist duties with agency and hospital staff, and visitors; and makes appointments for staff as requested.
Types technical material, subject to review by supervisor.
Corrects incidental grammatical errors, punctuation, and spelling
Modifies form letters to fit varying situations.
Compiles and types tables, charts, graphs and statistical reports.
Operates duplicating and office machines as required and instructs others in the operation of such machines.
Opens, screens, sorts, and routes mail according to content.
Maintains a moderately complex general office filing system.
Posts and maintains records, and takes timely and accurate action for follow-up as indicated.
May assist in maintaining clinical record forms and all supplies relevant to patient records; and orders and photocopies forms as needed.
May prepare new, open, and discharged clinical records as needed.
Maintains office supplies.
May assist in maintaining clinical record forms and all supplies relevant to patient records; and orders and photocopies forms as needed MINIMUM EDUCATION:
High School diploma or general education degree (GED); or equivalent combination of education and experience. MINIMUM WORK EXPERIENCE:
One to three months’ related experience and/or training.
Previous experience in an office setting is preferred. KNOWLEDGE, SKILL, ABILITIES:
Knows policy and procedures of the Department.
Demonstrates ability to type 30-35 words per minute.
Able to operate typewriter, computer, fax machine, and photocopier.
Demonstrates strong oral and written communication skills, and proofreading abilities.
Demonstrates ability to organize and maintain file system.
Demonstrated ability to work independently and follow instructions. If this describes you, then apply today for immediate consideration.

ORGANIZATIONAL BACKGROUND
Sinai Health System (SHS) is one the largest private safety net healthcare systems in Illinois. SHS includes Mount Sinai Hospital, Schwab Rehabilitation Hospital, Holy Cross Hospital, and 18 outpatient clinics. The system employs approximately 4,000 individuals and serves a geographic area of 1.5 million people on Chicago’s West and Southwest sides.
Through community programs delivered by Sinai Community Institute and research conducted by epidemiologists at Sinai Urban Health Institute, SHS has one of the broadest ranges of community services of any health system in the country and is on a trajectory to become the national model for urban healthcare.
We are continuing to building a new development enterprise and looking for creative, collaborative leaders who are passionate about using their skills and abilities to make a difference in the lives of those living is some of Chicago’s most underserved communities. If you are looking for an opportunity to use your knowledge and experience to help shape Chicago’s future and change individual’s lives, we would love to hear from you.
GENERAL SUMMARY:
Receives callers, determines nature of business, and directs callers to destination.

Corrects incidental grammatical errors, punctuation, and spelling
Modifies form letters to fit varying situations.
Compiles and types tables, charts, graphs and statistical reports.

Able to operate typewriter, computer, fax machine, and photocopier.

Demonstrates ability to organize and maintain file system.

Responsibilities
Are you outgoing and someone who loves interacting with people on a daily basis? Then Brookdale’s Receptionist job is for you! Our Receptionists greet visitors, answer phones, and are the face and voice of our communities. In this role, you will answer questions and help our senior residents and guests in a professional, pleasant and courteous manner. Become part of our family, grow your skills and career, and have the satisfaction of helping make seniors’ lives brighter every day.
Qualifications
What it take to be a Receptionist at Brookdale:
Receptionists greet all visitors entering the community, answer questions, ensure visitors sign guest sheets, and answer/direct phone calls to the proper residents and staff. Our Receptionists sort, deliver and collect incoming/outgoing community and resident mail, and may be asked to do basic office/clerical functions, and maintain visitor logs. You may also respond to resident emergencies by calling appropriate internal and external parties based on community protocol.  Schedule: Regular Part-Time

Must possess the ability to make independent decisions when circumstances warrant such action and to remain calm during emergency situations.
Must possess the ability to deal tactfully with residents, family members, visitors, personnel, government agencies/personnel, and general public.
Must possess leadership and supervisor’s ability and willingness to work harmoniously with other personnel.
Must have patience, tact, a cheerful disposition and enthusiasm.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
Must be able to move intermittently throughout the work day.
Must be able to cope with the mental and emotional stress of the position.
Must possess sight/hearing senses, or use prosthetics that will enable these senses to function adequately so that the requirements of this position can be fully met.

Follow established departmental policies and procedures, including appropriate dress code.

Recruit, interview, and select personnel with the approval of the Administrator (if applicable).
Schedule department work hours, personnel, work assignments, etc., to expedite work (if applicable).
Complete performance evaluations timely (if applicable).
Make daily rounds of reception area to assure that reception personnel are performing required duties and to assure that appropriate reception procedures are being followed (if applicable).
Perform other related duties as assigned.

Position Description:
At National Vision, we believe everyone deserves to see their best to live their best. We help people by making quality eye care and eyewear more affordable and accessible. National Vision, Inc. (NVI) is one of the largest optical retailers in the United States. We offer an innovative culture where training is a priority, hard work is praised, and career growth is a reality.
We are looking for a Receptionist to join our growing team. The Receptionist provides prompt, courteous service to customers either on the phone or in person. What would you do? – The Specifics
Ensure high quality customer service.
Ensure a smooth flow of customers through the store.
Answer, screen, and forward incoming phone calls in accordance with NVI protocol.
Process and understand managed care plans.
Obtain and document information from the insurance company as needed.
Schedule and confirm appointments, follow-up visits and classes.
File all patient records daily and pull patient files for the next day’s appointments.
Check on status and notify customers when orders are in or of any delays.
Ensure all WIP Report functions are performed daily; cancelled job status, backorder list and problem jobs.
Keep reception area tidy and presentable, with all necessary stationery and materials (e.g. pens, forms and brochures). Position Requirements:
Experience as a Receptionist, Front Office Representative or similar role is preferred.
Experience handling multiple phone lines.
Professional attitude and appearance.
Strong customer service skills.
Effective interpersonal skills.
Ability to be resourceful and proactive when issues arise.
Excellent organizational skills. What are the benefits?
National Vision offers a competitive benefits package including Health and Dental Insurance, 401k with company match, Flex Spending Account, Short Term and Long Term Disability Insurance, Life Insurance, Paid Personal Time Off, and much more. Please see our website www.nationalvision.com to learn more.

Meet and greet all clients and office visitors;

Kitchen duties;

Assistant Project Team, Principals and others in the firm with preparation of AIA contacts; submitting expense reports; maintaining Chicago office i-calendar, scheduling meetings, conferences and teleconferences,
Support the Marketing team with research, document preparation and other projects as needed;
General office tasks including scanning, printing, transcribing, formatting, inputting, editing, retrieving, copying, and transmitting text, data, and graphics.
To be successful in this role, you should have:
Three years minimum experience working in a professional services environment;
Positive, proactive, and team-mentality attitude;
Professionalism with excellent phone etiquette;
Strong organizational skills, with great attention to detail;
Advanced knowledge of MS Outlook, Word, and Excel are required;
Trustworthy, able to work with confidential material and maintain discretion;
Willingness to accept responsibility and to learn more/add tasks if necessary;
Ability to work both collaboratively and independently with minimal supervision or direction.

The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information.


The receptionist is responsible for providing front desk and administrative support to ensure optimal customer service and patient engagement through effective and efficient patient care processing. The position is vital to the patient care team and is instrumental in guiding the patient through the health care processes involved with their visit. The receptionist is essential in the revenue cycle process by ensuring correct data entry of patient demographics, thorough assessment of health care coverage, accurate health care coverage posting and appropriate cash collections.
Core Job Responsibilities
Greets patients and families in a warm, pleasant and prompt manner in person and over the phone. Handles all incoming call with courtesy. Answers incoming calls within three (3) rings. Refers patients to other members of the care team and/or external partners based on the nature of the visit/call.
Communicates with providers, medical assistants and other employees using a team-based approach to coordinate patient care.
Works effectively as part of the health care team and as an advocate for patients and their families helping patients navigate the system (referrals, health plans, etc.).
Helps patients navigate through the health center. Administers health center operational orientation to new patients and their families.
Obtains appropriate signatures on forms/consents. Enters/updates relevant patient information into EHR including scanning documents.
Explains and interprets ACCESS policies, procedures and protocols to patients and their families. Directs patients to benefits specialists as needed.
Screens patients for healthcare benefits/coverage and/or eligibility to participate in grants or other available programs. If patient is uninsured, help with orientation and enrollment in grant programs.
Schedule patients according to empanelment guidelines confirming primary care provider assignment with patient and addressing any discrepancies.
Determines patient payment source and/or type and adheres to defined collection polices and procedures. Explains financial requirements to the patients/families/responsible parties and collects co-pays as required.
Completes processing of the patient at the end of the visit, including any follow-up and/or additional cash collection. Ensures all patient concerns have been met prior to exit.
Completes procedures for reconciliation of encounters, cash receipts balancing and depositing of cash collections.
Upholds patient confidentiality and HIPAA standards at all times.
Acts in the best interest of the patients at all times, providing direct support and guidance when possible. When support is out of scope, provide a “warm hand-off” as defined by AHRQ to the appropriate party.
Calms and/defuses irate callers and patients by working with them to identify and properly address concerns.
Maintains all work areas and stations in a neat and orderly manner.
Receptionist job description continued
Performs other duties as assigned.
Requirements/Preferences
High school diploma or equivalent required
Basic proficiency in computer skills required
Administrative experience preferred
Customer service experience preferred
Competencies/Behaviors
Communication – ability to effectively communicate with diverse population
Customer service orientation
Organizational and time management
Ability to handle a fast-paced, stressful environment
Ability to multitask; talk on the phone, greet patients, make notes on the computer, check details, etc.
Ability to handle frequent interruptions
Ability to compassionately interact with and relate to people of diverse backgrounds; culturally sensitivity
Collaboration and team work – ability to act independently as well as work within a team.
Ability to solve problems and coordinate patient needs with the health center schedule.
Working Conditions/Equipment
Health Center Environment
Ability to sit for up to four (4) hours at a time.
Ability to stand for up to two (2) hours at a time.
Ability to lift and carry up to 10 lbs.
Occasional evenings and weekend shifts required.
Computer
Phone/Fax/Copier/Scanner


We Are Hiring
Coord-Physician Offc-Billing - Cardiology Chicago - Full-Time,Day - Chicago Metro Cardio - Chicago,IL
Why Join AMITA?
AMITA Health (www.AMITAhealth.org) is a joint operating company formed by the Adventist Health System in Altamonte Springs, FL and St. Louis, MO based Ascension.
AMITA Health is the largest health system in Illinois, comprising 19 hospitals and more than 230 sites of care. The health system has 900 providers in its medical groups, more than 26,000 associates and 7,000 physician partners and serves over 4.3 million residents in the greater Chicagoland area.
What You Will Do
As an Associate with AMITA Health, you will have the opportunity to
Organizes and coordinates the activities and flow of work for billing and collections functions.
Responsibilities:
Oversees patient access activities including pre-registration, insurance verification, patient registration, patient check out, upfront collections, billing and medical records and provides general administrative assistance to the provider.
Assists patients with meeting their financial obligations by providing education regarding co-pays, coinsurance, deductibles, and related matters. Functions as liaison between the business office and practice staff.
Evaluates documentation to ensure that appropriate, accurate, and complete information is maintained and appropriate authorizations are obtained.
Remains current on specific changes and requirements related to various insurance carriers.
What You Will Need
Education:
Diploma
High school diploma or GED required
Work Experience:
None required.

SUMMARY
The Office Administrator is a customer service-oriented position, focused on providing an elevated agent and client experience. It is also important that a professional office environment is maintained at all times as well as providing superior administrative support. The position involves working 2 days at our West Town location and 3 days in our busy Lakeview office.
ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES
Serve as front desk receptionist greeting agents and visitors in a professional and hospitable manner and ensuring their needs are met
Ensure daily ‘office rounds’ are completed - a checklist of tasks which maintain cleanliness and replenishes supplies for office. It also includes daily kitchen detail.
Answer incoming telephone calls during normal business hours
Receive and process earnest money, agent commissions, and tenant rent payments
Process applications
Coordinate refreshments for meetings and training sessions
Data entry and other administrative support as needed

Highly organized with an ability to prioritize.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment.
Experience in or exposure to the real estate industry is an advantage although not required

Experience with G Suite is preferred.

Position Summary
Now' data-auto_click_apply="0" data-auto_click_salary="0" data-auto_click_skills="0" data-auto_expand_description="0" data-do_check_salary="0" data-do_show_skills="0" data-first_after_email_message="You're almost done! Complete the form below to finish your application." data-has-salary="0" data-hiring_company_name="UroPartners, LLC" data-is_employer="1" data-job_url="/jobs/uropartners-llc-dfbade94/front-desk-receptionist-northwestern-cc755ca3" data-no_opening_messages="1" data-post_apply_message1="You’ve applied!" data-post_apply_message2_delay="6000" data-req_email_message="What email should the hiring manager use to contact you?" data-resume_required="1" data-show_desktop_flow="1" data-supports_apply_redirect="0" data-wkjt="Front Desk Receptionist" >
Interact with clients', medical professionals and additional team both within the clinic and at outside facilities offering precise, prompt and responsive information to facilitate the best patient care daily.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Administration
Schedules patients’ appointments either via phone or upon checkout according to scheduling guidelines. This includes but is not limited to requesting and verifying proper address, phone number, primary care physician, pharmacy, date of birth, insurance information and other demographics as required.
Greets patients on arrival and checks them in for their appointment. Patient check in requires but is not limited to verifying patient personal information, insurance information and other demographics as required. Scans in insurance cards and photo ID. Enters proper insurance information into practice management system for new patients. Obtains proper consents and necessary referrals and properly attaches appropriate referral to patient charts. Sends patients to washroom to provide urinalysis.
At conclusion of physician visit, checks patients out. Patient check out requires but is not limited to, providing patient with written clinical summary, scheduling next appointment, providing patient with patient portal information so they can log on to the Uropartners’ patient portal.
Answer phones and directs calls and message appointments to appropriate staff.
Providing patients with appropriate room for the evaluation and discussion of medical records, or results done by the appropriate medical staff.
Perform bookkeeping duties, such as credits and collections, preparing and sending financial statements and bills, keeping financial records and any other needed data entry.
Financial
Effectively and promptly balance cash receipts and credit card receipts at the end of clinic
Collect co-pays as well as patient balances
Verify insurance coverage and determine patient’s balances to be collected
Prepare invoices and collect monies for medical records
Supervisory Requirements
This position has no supervisory requirements
Educational Requirements
Required: High school diploma or general education degree (GED); or equivalent combination of education and experience
Preferred: One year certificate from college or technical school; or equivalent combination of education and experience
Experience
At least one year related experience and/or training
Licenses and Certifications
This position has no license or certification requirements
About UroPartners, LLC:
UroPartners is a privately held, premier healthcare group covering over 600 miles of the Chicagoland area. UroPartners is the second largest urology group practice in the country with more than 60 physicians, and nearly 400 employees. Our physicians offer outstanding urological care at over 30 Chicagoland offices, 35 hospitals, two radiation prostate treatment centers, and a pathology lab. Our hospital affiliations include but are not limited to: Advocate Health Care, AMITA, North Shore University Health System, Northwestern Medicine, Presence Health, and Rush Health System. Our focus is to provide world-class Urological care and the best experience for our patients.

The receptionist is responsible for providing front desk and administrative support to ensure optimal customer service and patient engagement through effective and efficient patient care processing. The position is vital to the patient care team and is instrumental in guiding the patient through the health care processes involved with their visit. The receptionist is essential in the revenue cycle process by ensuring correct data entry of patient demographics, thorough assessment of health care coverage, accurate health care coverage posting and appropriate cash collections.
Core Job Responsibilities
Greets patients and families in a warm, pleasant and prompt manner in person and over the phone. Handles all incoming call with courtesy. Answers incoming calls within three (3) rings. Refers patients to other members of the care team and/or external partners based on the nature of the visit/call.
Communicates with providers, medical assistants and other employees using a team-based approach to coordinate patient care.
Works effectively as part of the health care team and as an advocate for patients and their families helping patients navigate the system (referrals, health plans, etc.).
Helps patients navigate through the health center. Administers health center operational orientation to new patients and their families.
Obtains appropriate signatures on forms/consents. Enters/updates relevant patient information into EHR including scanning documents.
Explains and interprets ACCESS policies, procedures and protocols to patients and their families. Directs patients to benefits specialists as needed.
Screens patients for healthcare benefits/coverage and/or eligibility to participate in grants or other available programs. If patient is uninsured, help with orientation and enrollment in grant programs.
Schedule patients according to empanelment guidelines confirming primary care provider assignment with patient and addressing any discrepancies.
Determines patient payment source and/or type and adheres to defined collection polices and procedures. Explains financial requirements to the patients/families/responsible parties and collects co-pays as required.
Completes processing of the patient at the end of the visit, including any follow-up and/or additional cash collection. Ensures all patient concerns have been met prior to exit.
Completes procedures for reconciliation of encounters, cash receipts balancing and depositing of cash collections.
Upholds patient confidentiality and HIPAA standards at all times.
Acts in the best interest of the patients at all times, providing direct support and guidance when possible. When support is out of scope, provide a “warm hand-off” as defined by AHRQ to the appropriate party.
Calms and/defuses irate callers and patients by working with them to identify and properly address concerns.
Maintains all work areas and stations in a neat and orderly manner.
Receptionist job description continued
Performs other duties as assigned.
Requirements/Preferences
High school diploma or equivalent required
Basic proficiency in computer skills required
Administrative experience preferred

Communication – ability to effectively communicate with diverse population

Ability to solve problems and coordinate patient needs with the health center schedule.

Occasional evenings and weekend shifts required.

ORGANIZATIONAL BACKGROUND
Sinai Health System (SHS) is one the largest private safety net healthcare systems in Illinois. SHS includes Mount Sinai Hospital, Schwab Rehabilitation Hospital, Holy Cross Hospital, and 18 outpatient clinics. The system employs approximately 4,000 individuals and serves a geographic area of 1.5 million people on Chicago’s West and Southwest sides.
Through community programs delivered by Sinai Community Institute and research conducted by epidemiologists at Sinai Urban Health Institute, SHS has one of the broadest ranges of community services of any health system in the country and is on a trajectory to become the national model for urban healthcare.
We are continuing to building a new development enterprise and looking for creative, collaborative leaders who are passionate about using their skills and abilities to make a difference in the lives of those living is some of Chicago’s most underserved communities. If you are looking for an opportunity to use your knowledge and experience to help shape Chicago’s future and change individual’s lives, we would love to hear from you.

JOB DESCRIPTION
Summary
Provides general office support with a variety of clerical duties and related tasks. The receptionist will be responsible for answering incoming calls, directing calls to appropriate associates, mail distribution, flow of correspondence, requisition of supplies, providing administrative support for field staff as well as performing additional clerical duties.
Essential Functions
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Answers all calls in timely and polite manner. Directs the caller to the appropriate department utilizing professional call handling techniques including transfer, consult, conference or voicemail transfers when appropriate
Accept rental payments in person and over the phone in accordance with company policies
Takes and retrieves voicemail messages for various personnel
Monitor visitor activity ensuring they are not allowed beyond reception unless an appointment is set.
Provides callers with needed information such as company address, directions to the company location, company fax numbers, company website and other related information
Receives, sorts and forwards incoming mail
Follows up on maintenance related customer inquiries
Responsible for company general inbox email dissemination
Maintains and routes publications
Greeting all visitors, determine visitor needs in a professional manner, maintain visitor register and directs visitor to appropriate person
Coordinates the pick-up and delivery of express mail services (FedEx, UPS, etc.)
Assists with other related clerical duties such as photocopying, faxing, filing and collating
Assists HR with company-sponsored events
Required Qualifications
Attention to detail
Strong customer service skills
Adaptability to change
Excellent written/verbal communication utilizing diplomacy, tact and politeness
Basic office hardware and software skills
Excellent customer/client Focus and Courtesy
Neat professional grooming
Exceptional multitasking
Work Environment
This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.
Physical Demands
This is largely a sedentary role; however, some filing is required. This would require the ability to lift files, open filing cabinets and bend or stand as necessary.
Position Type and Expected Hours of Work
This is a full-time position. Days and hours of work are Monday through Friday, 09:00AM to 05:00 PM, however, hours may vary dependent upon workload.
Travel
No travel is expected for this position

Job Description:

This individual is responsible to serve callers and visitors by responding promptly through greeting, welcoming, and directing them appropriately.
Essential Job Functions:
Welcomes visitors by greeting them, in person or on the telephone; answering or referring inquiries promptly.
Answer Receptionist/front desk voice mail messages and respond appropriately.
Directs visitors by maintaining employee and department directories; giving instructions and referring inquiries to appropriate personnel.
Maintains safe and clean reception area.
Maintains confidential information in a professional and trustworthy manner.
Reserve/book conference rooms and keep rooms tidy by helping with cleaning and room prep.
Place food orders for catered office events.
At request of attorneys and supervisor, provide follow up and interact with clients, outside counsel and others.
Prepare, edit and proofread a variety of documents, e.g. correspondence, agreements and pleadings. Manage and assist with complex document production.
Assist administrative staff with overflow work, as requested by Office Manager.
Assist, as necessary, with the distribution of all in-coming mail (i.e., USPS, FedEx, UPS) and ensuring mail documents are loaded in firm system and distributed to attorneys.

Receptionist - Westside - copy 3752 W. 16th Street
Chicago, Illinois, 60623-2023
United States
About Access Community Health Network
Designated as a Level 3 patient-centered medical home by the National Committee for Quality Assurance (NCQA), ACCESS offers patient-centered, preventive and primary care services to more than 183,000 patients annually. Through its investment in technology to further improve patient care and engagement, ACCESS has also been recognized by HIMMS at Stage 6 for its adoption of its electronic health record. With 35 Joint Commission-accredited community health centers located throughout Chicago and the surrounding suburbs, ACCESS is also one of the largest networks of community health centers in the nation.
Position Functions:
The receptionist is responsible for providing front desk and administrative support to ensure optimal customer service and patient engagement through effective and efficient patient care processing. This position is vital to the patient care team and is instrumental in guiding the patient through the health care processes involved with their visit. In addition, this position is essential in the revenue cycle process by ensuring correct data entry of patient demographics, thorough assessment of health care coverage, accurate health care coverage posting, and appropriate cash collections.
Duties and responsibilities:
Customer service. Greets patients and their families in a warm, pleasant, and prompt manner in person and over the telephone. Handles all incoming calls courteously, professionally and promptly (within 3 rings). Meets the needs of the patients and keeps them in informed. Refers callers and walk-in patients to others as appropriate.
Team work. Maintains open lines of communication with providers, medical assistants, and other employees, and utilizes a team-based approach to coordinate patient care. Works effectively as part of the health care team, and as an advocate for patients and their families.
Patient orientation. Assists patients with navigating throughout the health center, as appropriate. Administers health center operational orientation to new patients, their family and others, as appropriate.
Patient registration. Obtains appropriate signatures, if applicable on forms/consents. Enters and/or updates relevant patient information into EHR, including scanning of appropriate documents. Explains and interprets ACCESS policies, procedures and protocols to patients and their families, as necessary. Directs patients to benefits counselors, as needed.
Benefits screening. Screens patients for healthcare benefits/coverage and/or eligibility to participate in grants or other available programs. If patient is uninsured, will assist with orientation and enrollment of said program(s), as appropriate.
Patient scheduling. Schedules patients according to empanelment guidelines confirming primary care provider assignment with patient and addressing any discrepancies.
Cash collection. Determines patient payment source and/or type and proceeds according to defined collection policies and procedures. Explains financial requirements to the patients/family/responsible parties and collects co-pays as required.
Check-out. Completes processing of the patient at the end of the visit, including any follow-up needed and/or additional cash collection attempts. Ensures all patient concerns have been met prior to their exit.
End of day procedures. Completes procedures for reconciliation of encounters, cash receipts balancing, and depositing of cash collections.
Confidentiality. Upholds patient confidentiality and HIPAA standards at all times.
Patient Advocate. Acts in the best interest of patients at all times, providing direct support and guidance when possible. When this support/guidance is out of scope, they provide a warm hand-off to the appropriate party.
De-escalation. Calms, and/or defuses irate callers and patients by working with them to identify and properly address concerns.
Work area. Maintains all work area/stations in a neat and orderly manner.
Other duties as assigned.
Job Requirements:
High school diploma or GED equivalent required
Basic computer skills
Requires staff to sit and stand for long periods of time
Some light lifting of supplies and materials from time to time
Occasional evening and weekend shifts
Our company provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics.


Tst Transport Logistics LLC - Chicago, IL

As a Frontdesk Agent, your responsibilities might include, but are not limited to, the following:
Greeting guests and completing the check-in steps. These include confirming guest booking is correct, collecting/processing credit card and cash payments, coding electronic keys, reviewing property policies, directing guests to their rooms, assisting with luggage as needed, and updating booking in frontdesk system.
Assisting guests with check-out by confirming bill is paid in full, collecting keys, storing luggage as needed, and updating booking.
Conversing with guests in a friendly manner, answering guest questions, and providing directions and/or recommendations on popular sites, restaurants, and general things to do and see in Chicago.
Answering phone inquiries and processing phone reservations through our property management system.
Monitoring frontdesk email inbox and responding to guest questions or forwarding to proper contact.
Handling guest concerns or complaints and involving manager as necessary.
Ensuring daily housekeeping manifest is accurate by auditing room statuses.
Monitoring the lobby and frontdesk area to ensure that all spaces are perfectly clean, neat, and organized. Light cleaning duties will be required as necessary including emptying trash bins, general tidying up, wiping surfaces, and ensuring paper and office products are in stock.
Communicating important information or events from your shift to the relieving Frontdesk Agent and providing written summary in internal system.
Other duties as assigned.

Overview
Company Description
Total Spectrum provides high quality in-home and center-based applied behavior analysis (ABA) services to children with Autism Spectrum Disorder
Job Description
At Total Spectrum, we're hiring for a Front Desk Receptionist for our West Loop clinic! The Front Desk Receptionist is responsible to assist in management for all daily office operations with a focus on customer service, organization development and information management. Hours for this position will be Monday-Friday 2:00-7:30 p.m. and Sundays 9:00 a.m. - 3:00 p.m.
Responsibilities
Answers all incoming calls
Collect incoming mail
Grant front door access, greet and direct all clients, trainees, employees and trusted business associates
Conduct tours of the clinic for new clients (with BCBA approval) and new employees
Complete tasks assigned by other office managers and clinical managers
Direct daily scheduling questions/issues from clients/parents/therapists in person to the designated CSC and provide a timeline for when an answer/solution will be provided
Address short term/same day cancellations and notify affected employees, clients, and designated CSC immediately
Coordinate room schedules after hours clinic coverage
Maintain office supply list, order new/replacement office supplies and put away deliveries upon receipt
Notify the Clinic Manager and Director of Operations of any facility issues (electric, plumbing, internet, etc.)
Ensure clinic common areas appear clean, organized and tidy
Route new client referrals to the assigned Intake Coordinator
Ensure that all responsibilities of this position are fulfilled in a timely and accurate manner per the Clinic Manager’s direction
Ensure all common areas of the clinic remain clean and stocked with necessary supplies
Represent the Company in a professional and courteous manner in all interactions with employees, clients and guardians
Report any misconduct, suspicious or unethical activities to the Compliance Officer
Ensure ongoing compliance with all laws and regulations; ensure that the department meets or exceeds accreditation standards; and implement ‘’best practices’’ in all departmental activities
Participate in the Company’s Performance Management program as requested by the Clinic Manager
Participate in Company committees when requested
Perform other duties as assigned by Clinic Manager
Qualifications
Organizational skills sufficient to maintain consistently accurate records
Bachelor’s degree
Two years of experience in healthcare
Computer skills that include word processing, and efficient use of the internet and e-mail


Chicago, IL Job Overview and Requirements
Blommer has been providing delicious, high quality chocolate to customers since 1939, and we owe it all to our people. Want to join an organization dedicated to attracting, developing, and investing in top talent? Join us on our mission to bring delight to customers every day. Here’s what you should know about working at Blommer:
We have a passion for quality and customer satisfaction – we are only as successful as our customers
We support our team members in achieving their goals by providing ongoing support and development opportunities
Our daily job is focused around our Core Values – Honesty, Integrity, Responsibility, Care and Customer
We are a family oriented company and understand how important it is to have a work-life balance
We have a commitment to sustainability – constantly working to end deforestation and forest degradation, safeguard the environment and preserve the planet
We’re here to make a product that everyone loves – let’s have fun while doing it! Sounds good to you? Here’s how you will bring chocolate to life: JOB SUMMARY:
The position serves primarily as the Receptionist for Blommer Chocolate Company. The Receptionist will handle incoming calls, direct to proper party. Additional responsibilities as HR Assistant include updating job descriptions and other HR paperwork and various other HR project work. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Timely and professionally respond to all incoming calls. Understand caller needs and determine appropriate area to transfer call or take a message.
Handle administrative functions that include updating job descriptions and uploading into HRIS system, prepare documents for distribution or mailing.
Sort mail for the Chicago location and prepare FedEx envelopes.
Update phone and e-mail list in UltiPro and SharePoint.
Assist on special projects as assigned. EDUCATION:
High school diploma required. Associates Degree a plus.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Show initiative and strong attention to detail
Experience working as a receptionist, preferably in a corporate environment
High School diploma is required. Associate’s Degree a plus. Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully:
Blommer is not seeking assistance or accepting unsolicited resumes from search firms for this employment opportunity. Regardless of past practice, all resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Blommer via-email, the Internet or directly to hiring managers at Blommer in any form without a valid written search agreement in place for that position will be deemed the sole property of Blommer, and no fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Blommer as a result of the referral or through other means. Compensation and Benefits
Blommer understands that our employees are our biggest assets. With this in mind we offer a generous benefits package that includes: Paid vacation and sick time, Health and Dental benefits on DAY OF HIRE, and Company Paid Life Insurance, AD&D, 401(k) plan, a generous Profit Sharing plan, 10 pounds of free chocolate for your birthday, free parking and more!

BASIC FUNCTION
With direction from the Administrative Director, provides broad administrative support to designated academic unit(s). Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, office reception, facilitating communication for faculty, staff, and students, maintenance of the unit calendars, booking travel arrangements for faculty and visitors, entering facility/ maintenance requests, and hiring, evaluating, and managing the student workers.
The candidate will initiate weekly procurement card purchases, receive orders for the departments, and file reconciliation information through Concur. PRIMARY DUTIES 1. Directly, or through delegation to student workers, provides daily reception services. Facilitates communication between the administrative staff, Department Chair(s)/Director, faculty, and students. 2. Serves as a reference and guides students to appropriate student service offices for assistance and counseling. 3. Directly, or through delegation to student workers, provides daily clerical assistance by scheduling appointments for departmental faculty administrators, maintaining office calendars, managing office correspondence, filing and organizing office records, distributing mail, answering phones, and photocopying. 4. Assists the Administrative Director to ensure a well-informed student and faculty community by generating and distributing information regarding policies, procedures, curriculum requirements, special study and work opportunities, meetings and events. 5. With supervision from the Administrative Director; facilitates the hiring of, manages payment to, and trains the TAs and Writing Tutors as needed. 6. General office work including, but not limited to, monitoring daily instructional activities, maintaining instructional supplies, oversight of room usage and maintenance, managing student equipment authorization records and key access lists, maintaining administrative databases and inventories, and processing invoices. 7. With direction from the Administrative Director; coordinates travel arrangements, per diem payments, and accommodations for faculty and visitors. 8. Submits and follows up on facility maintenance requests. 9. Provides assistance to the Department Chair(s)/Directors as requested, working closely with the Administrative Director to prioritize workflow and establish priorities. As time allows, provide clerical assistance to faculty. 10. Assists the Administrative Director and Department Chair(s)/Directors with special projects and Engage events; such as a department lecture series, student and faculty orientations, Conversations on Art and Science, etc. 11. Perform other duties as assigned by the Administrative Director and Faculty Chairs. 12. Works from the Writing Center reception desk one day each week and assists the Writing Center Coordinator with support and scheduling for students. 13. Assists with field trip tickets, catering costs, office supplies, and registration fees by making Pcard purchases and then reconciling Pcard purchases through Concur. Qualifications
High School diploma required; BA/BS/BFA strongly preferred
Previous clerical and administrative experience in a higher education or cultural organization
Very strong organization and communication skills
Ability to work well with students, faculty and staff at all levels
Ability to handle multiple projects and priorities
Preferred candidates will have Filemaker Pro and Google Suite experience/expertise
Benefits
We offer a competitive, comprehensive benefits package:
5+ weeks of paid time off
Paid holidays (up to 14 days)
Medical, dental, and vision insurance
Competitive retirement plan (up to 9% matching contribution)
Tuition remission and Tuition Exchange Program
Great employee discounts
Complimentary general admission to participating cultural institutions
Want to stay abreast of the latest job openings at the Art Institute?
Sign up for our Employment Opportunities E-announcements.
Application Time Out Warning
The Art Institute of Chicago requires all applicants to complete an online application to be considered for employment. 60 minutes are allotted for applicants to complete the employment application. The application will automatically time out after 60 minutes. If you are unable to submit the completed application at this time, please choose the "Save for Later" option to avoid losing the information you have entered so far.


POSITION OVERVIEW:
Rosin Eyecare is seeking a highly motivated individual for a Full Time Front Desk Receptionist position available at our Chicago Office.
The Receptionist is responsible for answering inbound calls and appointment reminders, outbound phone calls, scheduling patients, administrative functions, and providing superior customer service.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Professional Phone etiquette
Directly greet and service patients for scheduled appointments as well as impromptu visits

Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Verifying and retrieving benefits online for patients prior to appointment
Calling patients to confirm upcoming appointment
Provide general administrative support
Assist in discussing patient's prescription and eyewear options
For more information about Rosin Eyecare please visit our website at www.rosineyecare.com


Essential Functions of the position are detailed below, and include any physical requirements below that.
1. Greets and registers clients/visitors as they enter the site to ensure a welcoming environment.
2. Receives client and visitor complaints and directs them to his/her supervisory chain in compliance with Agency/Programmatic policies and procedures and treats each case with sensitivity and expedience.
3. Handles a wide array of administrative tasks to ensure compliance with agency/programmatic policies and procedures, professional standards, external requirements of all relevant regulatory, licensing or accrediting bodies in the course of performing job expectations.
4. Responsible for maintaining, updating and submitting routine and ad-hoc reports, as necessary.
5. Maintains up-to-date and accurate files and databases, as required by agency/programmatic policies and procedures, professional standards, and external requirements of all relevant regulatory, licensing or accrediting bodies in the course of performing job expectations.
6. Completes all required documentation in accordance with agency/programmatic policies and procedures, professional standards, and external requirements of all relevant regulatory, licensing or accrediting bodies.
PLEASE NOTE: Essential functions include all other duties and responsibilities as assigned.
X Kneel and move from sitting, bending, kneeling or standing multiple times a day.
X Push and pull objects up to 20 pounds.

Receptionist
Classification
Nonexempt
Reports to
Administrator or designee Summary/Objective
In keeping with our organization’s goal of improving the lives of the Guests we serve, the Receptionist is responsible for providing superior customer service by acting as the first point of contact for all visitors to the facility. The Receptionist will be responsible for answering incoming calls, directing calls to the appropriate persons and mail distribution. The Receptionist also supports multiple departments by providing general office/clerical support.
Essential Functions
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Operate multiline telephone and paging system.
Answer incoming calls, determine the nature of the call and route the call to the appropriate party.
Locate personnel by using overhead paging system.
Greets and directs all visitors to the facility, ensures that all visitors sign-in and refuse visitor’s entry to the facility if needed.
Reports suspicious behavior to the supervisor on duty.
Responds to inquiries regarding job openings and distributes job applications to perspective employees.
Receives, sorts and forwards incoming mail. Coordinates the pick-up and delivery of express mail services.
Responsible for reporting all guest and Guest concerns to the appropriate department head.
Maintains a list of all Guests by name and room number, staff extension numbers and key personnel.
Handles sensitive information regarding Guests and other facility matters with professionalism and confidentiality.
Works in an organized fashion and keeps lobby and workstation clean and free of hazards at all times.
Reports all hazardous conditions, damaged equipment and supply issues to the supervisor.
Communicates and interacts effectively and tactfully with Guests/guests, visitors, families, peers and supervisors.
Attend and participate in departmental meetings and in-services as directed.
Respond special requests made by guests, Guests and family members.
Recognize your role as part of the Quality Assurance and Performance Improvement (QAPI) efforts of your organization.
Attend trainings to build understanding and capacity to undertake QAPI work.
Carry out QAPI roles and responsibilities as assigned.
Follow established policies and procedures in support of QAPI efforts.
Look for and share with leadership ideas for improvement in the organization.
Communicate to leadership upon witnessing a positive outcome of a QAPI project or detecting barriers preventing project success.
Support QAPI efforts both verbally and non-verbally (i.e., via actions and attitude), including adjusting performance and practice in accordance with QAPI initiatives and findings.
Participate in compliance trainings as scheduled and adhere to compliance plan.
Supervisory Responsibility
This position has no supervisory responsibilities.
Work Environment
This job operates in a health care setting. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines. This role may also come into contact with patients who may have contagious illnesses.
Physical Demands
The role is largely sedentary; however, some miscellaneous tasks might be assigned which would require the ability to lift, open filing cabinets and bend or stand as necessary.
Position Type and Expected Hours of Work
This position is part of a health care facility that is open 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. Rotating shifts as well as holiday and work during inclement weather will be required.
Travel
No travel is expected for this position.
Required Education and Experience
High school diploma or equivalent.
Preferred Education and Experience
One year experience in a customer service role.
Additional Eligibility Qualifications
None for this position.
Other Duties
Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for their job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

CBRE is in search of an enthusiastic, driven, and proven hospitality professional to serve as a key member of our team in Chicago, Illinois. The client and Facility Management team serves as the heart of a broader service model, interfacing across the organization and integrating with all other workplace services to ensure timely and seamless delivery of amazing outcomes. Not your average front of house, the receptionist role is all about curating an engaged workplace, responding to a wide variety of on-site requests, and creatively exceeding expectations. The receptionist will anticipate and tackle challenges before they arise to make it easier for individuals to do the work they were hired to do while bringing delight to the workplace so that it is the desired destination to innovate. What you do: Responsibilities and essential job functions include but are not limited to the following: You Create Great Impressions through: Active engagement with all who enter and depart the workplace with a special emphasis on visitor care. Building relationships that enhance knowledge of employees and the business (including name-knowing and professional connection-making) to enhance professional experience onsite. Communication and diligent preparation for all events, working with partners and employees ensuring value, impact, and mission alignment as well as execution without incident. Coordinates setup of conference/meetings rooms. Arranges for and reserves projectors and other meeting equipment, ensuring equipment is in good operating condition. Arranges video and/or web conferencing as needed Coordinates catering for meeting and events. Proactively communicating through multiple channels to bring information to employees before they have to ask. Tirelessly creating opportunities for you and others to find enjoyment in the minor and major workplace moments. You Create Great Outcomes through: Being an active part of the broader service platform and across employee arc of day to anticipate and resolve obstacles in the workplace. Activating your passion for helping people work in new and better ways and sharing tools and resources that enable employees to adopt new and evolving ways of working. Maintaining the welcome desk and equipment and reporting on materials needs and requirements as established by CBRE leadership. Arranges equipment service as needed. Communicating with building staff to help resolve any issues that may arise, as appropriate. Performs general clerical duties associated with distributing office faxes, packages and mail as required. Uses tracking systems to record inbound and outbound courier, freight and mail. Arranges messenger service as needed. Follows location security procedures for screening inbound deliveries. Orders office supplies and other common use items for the location, such as café supplies, equipment toner, printer paper, freight and shipping supplies etc. Actively applying standards of service to meet and exceed expectations and tirelessly seeking opportunities to improve efficiencies and outcomes. Consistently collecting data, applying strategies to assess service delivery, reporting on outcomes, and delivering on improvements. You Create Delight through: Building community from the inside out and proactively engaging with the broader organization to make the workplace THE place for employees to connect and grow. Making connections to support all who enter the workplace and tirelessly seeking new ways to surpass employee expectations of how the workplace can support them. Activating curiosity to inform an ever-growing knowledge-base about the workplace and surrounding areas and proactively sharing knowledge and opportunities to spark joy across the day. Keeping a finger on the pulse of the local culture and establishing relationships with local hot-spots and vendors to provide information, ticketing, and reservations for office visitors and employees Performs other duties as assigned. Where You’ve Been: Working in hospitality or a similar service field for two years or more Partnering with facilities, food services, security, and technology leaders Working with other service teams across the organization Proving that expectations are meant to be exceeded Fueling curiosity towards the benefits of proven client outcomes Exercising personal growth and leadership, written/verbal communication and interpersonal skills Exceeding expectations for high-profile events, including under pressure Proficient in Microsoft Office, Word, Windows, Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint. All are essential to complete the tasks. Most importantly skills in Outlook, used daily. Physical Aspects of Position (include but are not limited to): Frequent standing and walking Occasionally engaging with (lifting, pushing, pulling) packages weighing up to 25lbs. QUALIFICATIONS To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE HS Diploma or GED required. Prior Front Desk, Concierge, customer service or other hospitality experience preferred. CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES None. COMMUNICATION SKILLS Ability to comprehend and interpret instructions, short correspondence, and memos and ask clarifying questions to ensure understanding. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints from clients, co-workers, and/or supervisor with a strong, professional customer service orientation. Blum Animal Hospital is passionate about pets! Since 1952, we’ve been providing Chicago pets with the highest level of veterinary care and customer service. Our state-of-the-art veterinary hospital, just south of Wrigley Field, is a frequent Readers’ Choice award winner, is accredited by AAHA and offers a comprehensive range of veterinary services for the finest in pet care.
We are seeking a full-time Veterinary Care Coordinator. Come join our growing small animal hospital with 10 veterinarians and more than 50 support staff. Previous experience in a veterinary clinic and/or Cornerstone software a plus! Ideal candidate will be seeking long-term employment with a desire to build lasting relationships with our clients and their pets. This is a busy practice and it requires one to maintain a positive and professional demeanor while multi-tasking under critical situations. Qualified applicant is a friendly, self-motivated team player who communicates well with great attention to detail. Duties include managing multiple phone lines, appointment scheduling, greeting clients, processing payments, and ensuring the reception area remains clean and presentable at all times. Schedule will include mornings, evenings and rotating Saturdays.
We are proud to have a rewarding & cooperative workplace environment that offers competitive salary & benefits. Would you like to work for a leading mid-sized Midwest Urgent Care Practice with a variety of growth opportunities in the Illinois or Indiana area? Physicians Urgent Care, also known as Physicians Immediate Care, is a Midwest leader in urgent care and occupational health services with over 40 locations in Illinois and Indiana. No appointments are required, and most clinics are open seven days a week, up to 12 hours a day, to treat non-life threatening illnesses and injuries. Our clinics are staffed by Providers, Physician Assistants, and Nurse Practitioners who provide quality, caring service, and effectively diagnoses and treats a variety of injuries and ailments. We are currently looking for full-time Medical Receptionists who can: Greet patients and direct them through the registration process

Answer phone calls
Provide excellent customer service

Come join our team!


Job Description
The Patient Service Representative is responsible for processing and updating patient’s information, schedule appointments and organizes the front desk to ensure a proper and efficient process as possible. The Patient Service Representative must greet all patients and clients in a professional manner.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES(included but not limited to the following);
Check-In
Greets patients and visitors, determining their needs, and directs them accordingly. Provide new patient’s information sheets and ensure completeness and accuracy. Processing necessary documentations with reference to registration, insurance verification and initial fee collection and routing to the appropriate clinic, personnel and/or department. Verify patient’s insurance status on established patients in the system and verify by way of Ecare, Medifax, or phone. Notes insurance status on the super bill (i.e., Cash, Medicare, Medicaid, BCBS, etc.). Enters and maintains demographic data for patients in Health Pro (patient data base system) and attach a copy of patient’s insurance information, ID and/or claim for to the super bill. Assists clients in the completion of necessary forms for registration and medical records requests. Collects co-payments during patients check-in with the PSR. Ensures the client receives quality and professional customer service throughout the duration of their visit.
Telephone Management
Proper telephone etiquette must be practiced at all times. Handles incoming phone calls; answers questions, gives information, directs calls and takes messages. Return patient messages for scheduling appointments.
Appointment Scheduling
Schedule physician appointments and retrieve appointment list for the next business day for front desk and medical records. Makes and checks off appointments as directed by physician guidelines. Cancels and reschedules appointments as necessary. Print appointment schedules for nurse and physician “check-off”. Call to remind patients of their scheduled appointments the day before appointment.
Check-Out
Schedule patient’s next appointment. Collects fees for patient’s when lab work is needed and process payments on balances. Organize super bills in insurance order ensuring none is missing. Compares super bill count to the number of patient’s on the sign-in sheet. Process charge entry and maintain client confidentiality.
Miscellaneous Duties
Prepares front desk area for the beginning of the next business day. Takes the initiative to find ways to improve the organization: 1) improve efficiency; and 2) improve customer service. Back-up other front office and back office personnel by helping them with their workload. Capable of dealing tactfully and effectively with patients, visitors, staff, and physicians.
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
High School or G.E.D. with courses in Typing. Experience in customer service and medical billing required. Knowledge of Health Pro and GE Centricity computer software, preferred.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee will be required to walk and or stand most of the day.
Staff Benefits
We offer a comprehensive benefits plan to all regular, full-time employees. Staff benefits include:
Medical Insurance—Blue Cross Blue Shield, HMO and PPO (shared premium)
Dental Insurance—Guardian, HMO and PPO (shared premium)
Employer-Paid Basic Life and Accidental Death & Dismemberment (AD&D) Insurance
Employer-Paid Long Term Disability
401(k) Retirement Savings Plan
** NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE **
Job Type: Full-time
Experience:
Relevant: 1 year (Preferred)
Customer Service: 1 year (Preferred)

BASIC FUNCTION
With direction from the Administrative Director, provides broad administrative support to designated academic unit(s). Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, office reception, facilitating communication for faculty, staff, and students, maintenance of the unit calendars, booking travel arrangements for faculty and visitors, entering facility/ maintenance requests, and hiring and managing the student workers. PRIMARY DUTIES
1. Directly, or through delegation to student workers, provides daily reception services. Facilitates communication between the administrative staff, Department Chair(s)/Director, faculty.
2. Serves as a reference for students to appropriate student service offices for assistance and counseling.
3. Directly, or through delegation to student workers, provides daily clerical assistance by scheduling appointments for departmental faculty administrators, maintaining office calendars, managing office correspondence, filing and organizing office records, distributing mail, answering phones and photocopying. 4. Assists the Administrative Director to ensure a well-informed student and faculty community by generating and distributing information regarding policies, procedures, curriculum requirements, special study and work opportunities, meetings and events.
5. With supervision from the Administrative Director; facilitates the hiring of, manages payment to, and trains the TAs. 6. General office work including, but not limited to, monitoring daily instructional activities, maintaining instructional supplies, oversight of room usage and maintenance, managing student equipment authorization records and key access lists, maintaining administrative databases and inventories, processing invoices. 7. With direction from the Administrative Director; coordinates travel arrangements, per diem payments, and accommodations for faculty and visitors. 8. Submits and follows up on facility maintenance requests. 9. Provides assistance to the Department Chair(s)/Directors as requested, working closely with the Administrative Director to prioritize workflow and establish priorities. As time allows, provide clerical assistance to faculty. 10. Assists the Administrative Director and Department Chair(s)/Directors with special projects and events; such as a department lecture series, student and faculty orientations, etc. 11. Perform other duties as assigned by the Administrative Director and Faculty Chairs. Qualifications
QUALIFICATIONS High School diploma required; BA/BS/BFA strongly preferred
Previous clerical and administrative experience in a higher education or cultural organization
Very strong organization and communication skills
Ability to work well with students, faculty and staff at all levels
Ability to handle multiple projects and priorities

5+ weeks of paid time off

Maintains a calendar of hearing and trial dates and provides reminders of commitments and court appearances.
Schedules conferences and interviews for office personnel.
Coordinates scheduling of trial preparation rooms.
Produces a variety of written documents and materials utilizing a wide range of office software applications.
Ensures proper format, spelling, punctuation, capitalization, and grammar.

Address short term/same day cancellations and notify affected employees, clients, and designated CSC immediately
Coordinate room schedules after hours clinic coverage
Maintain office supply list, order new/replacement office supplies and put away deliveries upon receipt
Notify the Clinic Manager and Director of Operations of any facility issues (electric, plumbing, internet, etc.)
Ensure clinic common areas appear clean, organized and tidy
Route new client referrals to the assigned Intake Coordinator
Ensure that all responsibilities of this position are fulfilled in a timely and accurate manner per the Clinic Manager’s direction
Ensure all common areas of the clinic remain clean and stocked with necessary supplies
Represent the Company in a professional and courteous manner in all interactions with employees, clients and guardians
Report any misconduct, suspicious or unethical activities to the Compliance Officer
Ensure ongoing compliance with all laws and regulations; ensure that the department meets or exceeds accreditation standards; and implement ‘’best practices’’ in all departmental activities
Participate in the Company’s Performance Management program as requested by the Clinic Manager
Participate in Company committees when requested
Perform other duties as assigned by Clinic Manager

Our practice is well established and consists of three on-staff physicians. We have in-office laboratory services and a growing patient population. Being located on the Rush campus also gives our patients and doctors convenient access to imaging services, medical specialists, Midwest Orthopedics, and various other hospital based services.
The medical receptionist is the first person a patient interacts with when they walk through the door or call our office. The patient's perception of our medical practice begins with that first interaction. The ideal candidate will be professional and welcoming with a pleasant demeanor. Experience as a receptionist is required. Computer experience and familiarity with EMR systems (EPIC) is a plus. The ideal candidate will be bilingual (Spanish).
Job responsibilities are as follows:
Greet and check-in patients on arrival.
Collect co-pays and necessary signatures
Scan insurance documents and work with the registration department to verify demographics
Check-out patients at the conclusion of their physician visit
Schedule patient appointments, via telephone or in-office
Answer phones and direct calls and/or messages to the appropriate staff
Assist with faxes and copying
Perform other clerical tasks to support the doctors, as needed
Provide superior customer service

Paid medical and dental insurance

What We'll Accomplish Together:
We are passionate about health and wellness.
At Massage Envy, we help people feel their best. Treating your body well shouldn’t be a luxury. Our bodies work hard for us and that hard work takes its toll. While massages and skincare may be relaxing, we believe they are body maintenance, pure and simple.
Our Sales and Customer Service Associates create a warm, fun, and friendly atmosphere where our clients feel at home. We use our enthusiasm for wellness to ensure our clients take full advantage of everything their membership has to offer and keep them loving their services. If you have a dynamic, fun, passionate spirit and an exceptionally positive attitude, you are our ideal candidate!
Massage Envy is actively seeking applicants who have an enthusiasm for wellness and body care! We are looking for Sales and Customer Service Associates for full and part time positions.
Everyone on our team loves the flexible scheduling we offer, as well as our 50% employee discount on massages, facials, and retail products. Everyone on our team accrues PTO, and additionally can take unlimited unpaid time off. We have trainers who are devoted to your continued development through your employment with us. We are open 7 days a week, so we all work nights and weekends (our busiest times!) as well.
What it Takes to Succeed:
As a Sales and Customer Service Associate at Massage Envy, you will be able to contribute to the well-being of our customers by:
Providing excellent customer service to our members and guests.
Creating a warm, fun, friendly relationship with members and guests.
Achieving individual goals in appointment setting, upgrading, and sales.
Assisting with client appreciation events, POP displays, and contests.
Resolving customer service issues with a smile.
Communicate with members and guests in person, via phone, email, and letters.
Keeping our clinic clean by performing light cleaning and stocking.
We are looking for Sales and Customer Service Associates who:
Have an exceptionally positive attitude and are passionate about health and wellness!
Have the availability to work a combination of days, nights, and weekends.
Massage Envy Franchising, LLC (“MEF”) is a national franchisor of independently owned and operated franchised locations. Each individual franchised location, not MEF or any of its affiliates, is the sole employer for all positions posted by a franchised location, and each individual franchised location is not acting as an agent for MEF or any of its affiliates. Hiring criteria, benefits and compensation are set by each individually owned and operated franchised location and may vary from location to location.

What you'll do
As the first smile that our employees and visitors see at Billtrust, you will utilize your upbeat attitude to provide exceptional customer service at the front in our Downtown Chicago office. You will handle the flow of people through the business and ensure that all receptionist responsibilities are completed accurately and delivered with high quality.
This includes screening and forwarding incoming phone calls as well as effectively communicating with all vendors and service providers. Your well-developed multi-tasking skills will be critical as you manage various administrative support tasks such as assisting in the planning and managing of company events, sorting incoming and outgoing mail, and replenishing our office and break room supplies. As part of our HR team, you will also act as the Ambassador for the Billtrust Employee Relations team in Downtown.
What you'll bring to the team
Professionalism, strong interpersonal skills and a positive attitude; our Receptionist is a cheerleader for our company
Strong multi-tasking skills and an ability to prioritize tasks independently under tight deadlines
Microsoft Office skills combined with strong written communication skills to effectively create and distribute company- wide correspondence
Proactive mindset to anticipate roadblocks and an ability to provide solutions as they arise
Willingness and ability to utilize well-honed organizational skills in activities such as planning and coordinating events or taking on administrative support tasks as needed
What you'll get
Competitive pay and 401(k) with company match: We appreciate our employees and we make sure they know it.
PTO: Work-life balance is important. We believe in giving our employees time to truly relax and recharge.
Paid Parental Leave: To keep our employees and their families healthy.
A Lively Culture: Ping-pong, bean bag toss, hackathons- we enjoy friendly competition.
Casual Dress: Every day is “Casual Friday’, we want you to be comfortable when you come to work.
Minimal Bureaucracy: An entrepreneurial environment of ownership and accountability allows you to get work done.
Who we are
Billtrust is the best-in-class provider of Payment Cycle Management and accounts receivable solutions, helping businesses accelerate Invoice-to-Cash. We provide a flexible, automated, cloud-based product portfolio that meets diverse buyer requirements and speeds cash application through tailored invoice delivery, secure multi-channel payment enablement, and intelligent matching and payment posting. Our platforms process $15B+ annually and help companies like Kraft Foods, New Balance Athletics and Ferguson Enterprises get paid faster and more efficiently. For the past 17 years, we have achieved remarkable success with year-over-year growth and we attribute that growth to our people and culture - We encourage employees to have autonomy, think creatively, share ideas – even with our CEO – and to challenge the status quo every day without a lot of red tape. Billtrust: Work Hard. Have Fun. Make History.
