Are you looking for a company that is going to commit to you and your career growth? Where you are treated with respect and trust? Do you want to be a part of a company that promotes safety, patience and understanding? If you answered yes, then Midwest Goods Inc is the place for you. Our focus is to maintain a work environment that inspires all employees to be the best that they can be. Midwest Goods Inc wants to continue to grow as a company, team and family!
Since 2014, Midwest Goods Inc has experienced an exceptional amount of growth. We are proud to be one of the largest Wholesale Distributors in the Midwest and that success comes from our dedicated team. We value each employee and commit to their future. We show our appreciation by having competitive pay, excellent benefits, monthly birthday celebrations, award ceremonies, weekly lunches and more. Midwest Goods has envisioned to be the global leader of the e-cigarette industry with the best online shopping experience, customer care and product selection. Our determined team, along with our loyal customers will guarantee our success.
Key Responsibilities
Responsible for handling front office reception and administration duties, including greeting guests and offering them a beverage, answering phones, handling company inquiries, and sorting and distributing mail. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Working the front desk and assisting visitors / employees.
Greet visitors warmly and make sure they are comfortable.
Direct visitors to the appropriate person and office.
Maintain security by following procedures; checking visitors in and out; issuing visitor badges.
Answer, screen and route incoming phone calls.
Provides callers with information such as company address, directions to the company location, company fax numbers, company website, and other related information.
Generate reports, create presentations, and conduct research.
Manage staff appointments.
Order office and warehouse supplies.
Maintain supplies inventory by checking stock to determine inventory level; anticipating needed supplies; placing and expediting orders for supplies; verifying receipt of supplies.
Receive daily mail/deliveries.
Manage and prepare reception and conference room area.
Work on required projects supporting departments.
Make independent decisions and function with minimal supervision.
Respond promptly, efficiently, and professionally at all times.
Make coffee and set food for visitors and CEO.
Assist with other related clerical duties such as photocopying, faxing, filing and collating.
Perform other duties as assigned by the Office Manager.
Skills & Experience
High school diploma or GED with at least one year of work experience in a clerical/office support position; or any combination of education, training and experience that demonstrates the ability to perform the duties of the position.
Intermediate computer skills and Microsoft Office experience including Word, Excel.
Knowledge of Google-based programs such as Google Sheets/Docs.
Inventory management experience is a plus.
Executive Assistant experience is a plus.
Detail oriented
Multi-tasking ability
Position Type/Expected Hours of Work
This is a full-time position, 40 hours per week.

Description
Position Summary
The LifeSpa Coordinator operates the telephone system to answer incoming calls and directs callers to appropriate personnel in a manner that exceeds the caller’s expectations, presenting a cheerful and pleasant attitude at all times. They also assist the Department Head with filing and other office duties as needed.
Job Duties and Responsibilities
Answers incoming internal calls to greet, schedule appointments, and service members in a friendly and professional manner
Converts LifeSpa questions into appointments
Explains all Life Spa products, services, and treatments to guests and assists them with determining their individual needs
Suggests upgrades or add-ons to products and services
Completes outgoing confirmation calls, Beautiful Beginning calls, and myLT Bucks calls to schedule appointments
Uses all required safety devices to comply with company safety rules Position Requirements
High School Diploma or GED
1 year of customer service experience
CPR and AED certified within 30 days of hire
Knowledge of computer software such as Microsoft Office, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook
Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest and commissions
Ability to stand, sit, walk, reach, climb and lift up to 50 pounds Preferred Requirements
1 year of receptionist experience


Meet Fulton Grace, one of Chicago's most rapidly growing residential real estate companies! Recently named as a Crain's Top Chicago workplace (we ranked #37!), our team is fortunate to have some of the city's best and brightest employees. Currently we have an opening for a office administrator/ receptionist to support our brokers, staff and clients. We offer a competitive benefits package, opportunity to grow, and an outstanding workplace environment.
Job Title: Office Administrator/ Receptionist
Location: 2901 N Halsted & 1448 N Western
SUMMARY
The Office Administrator is a customer service-oriented position, focused on providing an elevated agent and client experience. It is also important that a professional office environment is maintained at all times as well as providing superior administrative support. The position involves working 2 days at our West Town location and 3 days in our busy Lakeview office.
ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES
Serve as front desk receptionist greeting agents and visitors in a professional and hospitable manner and ensuring their needs are met
Ensure daily ‘office rounds’ are completed - a checklist of tasks which maintain cleanliness and replenishes supplies for office. It also includes daily kitchen detail.
Answer incoming telephone calls during normal business hours
Receive and process earnest money, agent commissions, and tenant rent payments
Process applications
Coordinate refreshments for meetings and training sessions
Data entry and other administrative support as needed
QUALIFICATIONS
Prior administrative experience is required.
Highly organized with an ability to prioritize.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment.
Experience in or exposure to the real estate industry is an advantage although not required
Effective communication skills and an outgoing personality.
Experience with G Suite is preferred.

Description
Every 3 minutes, someone calls Children’s Home & Aid for help for a child. Be a part of answering the call. The Receptionist provides the first interaction for a variety of clients via phone and in-person greetings at our office at 100 N. Western Avenue. This office supports a range of programs serving children and parents including Adoption Services, Counseling, and services for youth in care. This temporary part-time position covers morning hours, Monday through Friday (8:30am-1:30pm), and ends in approximately February of 2020.
Responsibilities include:
Answer and direct telephone calls using a multi-line phone system
Greet visitors and manage the reception area
Maintain staff calendars and schedules
Process and manage both incoming and outgoing mail
Complete data entry and filing for multiple programs
Qualifications:

Two years secretarial/clerical experience preferred
Familiarity with Microsoft Office products, including Word, Excel, and Outlook
Bilingual (English/Spanish) required
Able to work independently on multiple projects/tasks in a fast-paced environment
Excellent organizational skills
Strong interpersonal skills and an interest in developing and maintaining helpful relationships with colleagues, clients, and the public

The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information.


Are you looking for a new challenge that offers a rewarding and fun atmosphere in a growing organization? Shook, Hardy & Bacon L.L.P. offers a team environment, providing exceptional legal services to a diverse array of clients. Shook protects the best in the world - household names and leaders in their industries, including nearly three-quarters of the Fortune 100. We not only understand our business partners and their people, products and processes, but leverage this institutional knowledge to ensure consistency and accountability no matter the size or complexity of the engagement.
We are seeking an experienced Legal Administrative Assistant/Legal Practice Assistant to join our legal team. The ideal candidate will be a highly motivated, energetic, self-starter, who is flexible and able to multi-task. This person will draft, prepare, proofread and format legal correspondence and court filings; electronically file pleadings in state and federal courts; manage calendars and track court deadlines; and provide administrative support to attorneys and paralegals. Other responsibilities include arranging catering and travel accommodations; reception coverage; and scheduling meetings and conference room set ups. The right candidate will demonstrate excellent communication and organizational skills, flexibility, initiative, and strong proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook. Must type at least 50 wpm. Must have a high school diploma or GED and three years litigation experience, OR equivalent combination of education and/or experience. Bachelor's degree, ALS, PLS, CAP, or Paralegal certificate preferred. We provide on-going learning and career development, you provide the desire to expand your horizons in a supportive team environment. High School diploma or GED and five years related experience or; ALS, PLS or CPS certification or paralegal certificate with three years related experience. A Bachelor's degree is preferred. Ability to type 50 WPM. Must have skills in Electronic Court Filing (ECF). Advanced knowledge in Microsoft Word (styles, tables, Table of Authorities & Table of Contents), Excel (charts/graphs/tables), PowerPoint, Outlook and Carpe Diem. Must have basic knowledge of legal terminology. Skilled in the use of a redlining tool. Working knowledge of case management and litigation support databases. Experience and knowledge in docket management systems. Must be able to use legal citations and apply to firm documents. Required to obtain PLS or CPS certification prior to promotion to Level III-Assistant. Ability to anticipate, identify, and proactively implement actions that allow timekeepers to be efficient and effective in serving client needs. Shares knowledge and mentors others on technology applications and firm/division processes.
Preference given to individuals who can work the hours of 9:30am-5:00pm do to business needs

Job Description
Role Overview
We are looking for a qualified full-time Front Desk to act as the first point of contact for patients in our Melrose Park, IL office. The right applicant will have experience greeting patients, verifying insurance and personal information, answering questions and directing patients until they are met by the Dental Assistant. Front Desk is responsible for general administrative tasks associated with the efficient running of the office.
Responsibilities
Greet patients and check guests in according to established office protocols and verify and update patient information
Move patients through appointments as scheduled and schedule appointments ensuring patients are attended to on time
Collect payments from patients at time of treatment and Inform patients of financial treatment plan options
Manage inbound and outbound calls in a timely manner
Requirements
Previous administrative work in a dental office is required
Positive attitude and enthusiasm for the workday
Excellent customer service skills with an outgoing, people friendly personality
The ideal applicant will display and demonstrate excellent communication skills with staff and patients
Desire to learn new skills and expand your potential
Compensation Package
Compensation will be comprised of a base salary that is commensurate with experience
Job Type: Full-Time
Company Overview
United Dental Partners is a very fast-growing Dental Support Organization (DSO) serving multi-specialty dental practices. We are headquartered in Chicago and owned and operated by our two founders – one an orthodontist, the other a pediatric dentist. The multi-specialty group we serve collectively cares for children and adults and offers general, pediatric, orthodontic and oral surgery care across multiple brands.
We work in an energetic environment with phenomenal people who love providing fantastic care for patients and know that our ability to provide consistently great care is underpinned by the personalities and values of the people we hire and by excelling at the process.
Job Type: Full-Time

Multi-profile very busy medical office in Skokie, IL has immediate position of EXPERIENCED front desk receptionist / secretary with experience in medical billing.
GOOD ENGLISH and RUSSIAN!!!
We offer:
- competitive wage and benefit package
- health insurance, dental, vision (your spouse can be covered as well),
- 401K,
- paid vacation,
- paid holidays
- sick days
Responsibilities and Duties
Responsible for receiving patients and visitors, determining their needs and directing them accordingly. Answers telephone, makes appointments, and receives payments and issues receipts.
Generates revenue by making payment arrangements; collecting accounts; monitoring and pursuing delinquent accounts. Responsible for entering and coding patient services into a computer system and generating invoices to be sent to the patient. Sorts and files paperwork, handles insurance claims, and performs collections duties.
Performs other clerical and administrative tasks as required.
- Greets visitors and patients, determines their needs, and directs them accordingly.
- Answers questions and gives information directly or via the telephone within the limits of knowledge and the practice policies.
- Makes and checks off appointments, giving routine non-medical instructions in preparation for the patient's visit to the practice.
- Retrieves and files medical records, letters, reports and miscellaneous items as requested.
- Answer, take messages and redirect phone calls.
- Typing and filling.
- Collect fees, issue receipts and counsels patients concerning their accounts when necessary
- Counts and balances money at the end of the day.
- Review patient bills for accuracy and completeness and obtain any missing information
- Knowledge of insurance guidelines especially Medicare and state Medicaid
- Translate patient information and into alphanumeric medical code.
- Collect, post, and manage patient account payments.
- Follow up to see if a claim is accepted or denied.- Investigate rejected claim to see why denial was issued.
- Call insurance companies regarding any discrepancy in payments if necessary
- Follow up on unpaid claims within standard billing cycle time frame
- Investigate insurance fraud and report if found.
- Answer all patient or insurance telephone inquiries pertaining to assigned accounts.
- Provides clerical support to the admitting staff.
- Performs general maintenance of the facility and office equipment.
- A certain degree of creativity and latitude is required.
- Performs other duties as required.
- Reports to a supervisor or manager.
Qualifications and Skills
Requires a high school diploma and medical assistant or medical receptionist certificate and 0-2 years of experience in a related field. Previous patient contact work in a medical practice would be an advantage. Type 60 words per minute with accuracy. Possess the tact required for work situations that involve dealing with patients to secure payment of delinquent accounts. Possess the tact to work effectively with patients, physicians and other employees in the environment. Possess a preference for dealing with people who are ill and need help. Exceptional customer service and phone etiquette. Familiar with standard concepts, practices, and procedures within a particular field. Relies on limited experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Performs a variety of tasks.Has knowledge of commonly used concepts, practices, and procedures within a particular field.
Good starting salary based on experience.
Call 847-329-0471 and ask Marta or reply to this post

Executive Administrative Assistant POSITION SUMMARY/PURPOSE:
Provide administrative support and perform project work for the executive team. Conduct research, prepare complex presentations, develop spreadsheets, etc. for the executive team and support their respective functions. Handle sensitive information and maintain strict confidentiality. Prioritize work including planning, organizing, and scheduling. Duties include but are not limited to data entry, scheduling and calendaring, creating and processing communications (including copying, faxing, scanning, mailing, and filing), processing expense reports, scheduling conference rooms, facilitating video conference calls and related technology, performing general set-up and clean-up, supporting travel for leadership, attending conferences (as needed), and interfacing with customers or visitors. May provide support for key directors or managers as assigned. Back up Reception desk as needed. Provide assistance to other departments as required.
POSITION ACCOUNTABILITIES:
Executive Support:
Prepare a wide variety of correspondence, reports and presentation materials using word processing, spreadsheet and presentation software applications for executive team and projects within their respective areas of responsibilities.
Conduct research as needed. Prepare expense reports, develop appropriate methods for handling information, and organize and maintain records and files (physical and electronic). Facilitate calls and video conferences.
Provide support for Chicago office managers or directors as needed. Ensure follow-up on ongoing initiatives. Serve as a resource for the organization as needed.
Officer Support:
Provide executive level administrative and support for Officers.
Travel and Meetings:
Make travel reservations in Concur Travel as necessary for the Executive Team. Assist Travel Supervisor with meeting planning of offsite conferences.
Attend and support management conferences as needed.
Other Responsibilities:
Back-up Reception desk. Perform general set-up and clean up, order supplies, and be a resource to others as necessary. Perform other duties as assigned. Stay current on office technology.
Accomplish work in an organized, timely manner producing necessary results in spite of unforeseen changes; communicate effectively and alert team members and supervision if deadlines are in jeopardy; maintain high ethical and quality standards; and correct your own errors; and, regularly produce accurate, thorough, professional work.
Additionally, recommend continuous improvement ideas and assist in implementation as required; take personal responsibility for service excellence, sustainability and safe working practices; and, understand and adhere to our Principles & Values and all company policies and procedures.
JOB KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS AND ABILITIES:
Proficiency using Microsoft Office programs including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.
Able to use common office equipment and technology including: computers, facsimile machines, scanners, copiers, video conferencing and smart phone technology.
Strategic thinker and resourceful problem solver.
Detail oriented with the ability to multi-task efficiently, prioritize work, and maintain strict confidentiality.
Understand the organization's general philosophy and goals.
Poised, articulate, and consistently projects a positive, professional image in all dealings and interactions with internal and external customers.
PROFESSIONAL WORK EXPERIENCE:
Experience as an executive level administrative assistant preferred.
EDUCATIONAL AND/OR TRAINING REQUIREMENT:
High School diploma or equivalent plus specialized training.
Bachelor’s degree preferred


Responsibilities
Sentinel is looking for an Administrative Assistant to join our team. As an Administrative Assistant, you will be responsible for but not limited to the duties listed below as part of the Administration Team. This position reports to the Facilities & Administration Manager. The Administration responsibilities encompass a wide variety of tasks and projects including, but not limited to: Creating contracts for the sales team, proofing and creating PDF’s for proposals following corporate standards, formatting, proofing, PDF Bill of Material Excel files into standard format, entering deals into proprietary system, processing contracts through DocuSign, utilization of SharePoint and other proprietary systems for process work flows, binding proposals. They assist the sales team with RFP’s or RFB’s (requests for proposals or requests for bids by coordinating the required documentation for submittal by formatting, proofing, binding, creating tabs and preparing for shipping as required. Position involves some catering and reception coverage which includes occasionally answering incoming calls, distributing mail, distributing faxes, greeting visitors. Additional responsibilities will be assigned as this individual becomes trained and familiar with the primary admin responsibilities and in one or more of the following areas: Onboarding internal employees, Travel arrangements, Recruiting support, RFP administration, and Facility support. Miscellaneous projects will be assigned as the business requires.
The ideal candidate will be a self-starter with organizational, time-management skills and a “can-do” attitude and work well independently. This position is a full time opportunity located in Downers Grove, IL.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Manages clinic schedule to ensure efficient and expedient patient care for walk-in appointments, scheduled appointments and potential customers.
Maximize center efficiency by setting appointments, scheduling provider availability, scheduling center availability, updating patient information, physician information and entering & tracking orders/invoices.
Marketing outreach to patients and potential customers via telephone and community events.
Works within a team environment with other members of the center staff to achieve goals established by Regional and Main office management.
Maintains detailed and accurate records of cash and bank deposits, inventory and call activity.
Maintains basic knowledge of hearing instrument function and troubleshooting.  SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
1 to 2 years experience
Basic Microsoft Office skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) - Willingness to learn and use new computer programs/applications
Ability to process high volume data entry.
Ability to pay close attention to detail with a high degree of accuracy.
Ability to work quickly, accurately and independently in a fast paced environment.
Basic or advanced written communication skills.
Experience interacting with customers/clients.
Familiar with insurance procedures.
Ability to work overtime.
This position does not require travel.
HS diploma or equivalent required.


Are you looking for a flexible schedule where you could make extra money in a fun professional environment? We are looking for a dynamic, customer service oriented individual to help us run an Aveda Salon in the Des Plaines/Mt Prospect area. The hours are flexible, the pay is good and we have fun perks.
Our Guest Service Specialist is a key part of the team, and will be responsible for opening and closing sales, educating customers on products and services, welcoming clients and providing them with an outstanding service experience.
Our goal is to provide legendary customer service to all of our clients, building a highly satisfied and loyal customer base through engagement.

POSITION SUMMARY
The Patient Service Representative (PSR) will perform various patient registration, scheduling, front desk and customer service functions. Additionally, The PSR will also verify insurance, handle complaints, troubleshoot potential customer issues, and provide basic customer service functions in achieving high performance standards.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Maintains patient confidentiality through patient contact as indicated by the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA).
Registers patients in the health centers, explains and interprets CFHC policies, procedures and protocols to patients and their families when necessary.
Schedules patients according to empanelment guidelines, confirming primary care provider assignment with patient and addressing any discrepancies.
Accurately verifies payor source.
Obtains and updates demographics and insurance information in a professional and courteous manner.
Ensures that each patient who registered has a generated encounter form.
Receives and handles patient payments at time of service
Responsible for calculation and tabulation of payments, cash box security, and reconciliation of daily cash receipts.
Prepares, and secures delivery of daily collections at the beginning of each day.
Assist patients when needed to be referred to additional programs within Chicago Family Health Center.
Faxes, files, and scans appropriate documents, generates reports and prepares for mail-out.
Monitor patient’s flow from time of registration to treatment area, and ensures all patient concerns have been met.
Maintain office supplies, and forms necessary to carry out duties.
Contributes equitably in the maintenance of cleanliness of the medical practice.
Ensure the waiting, and reception areas are kept neat, clean, safe from any hazards, and reporting on any damages.
Frequently checks, responds and communicates using all forms of communication
Serves as back-up person to open, and close the health center in the absence of assigned individual/s.
Exhibits high level of customer service and follows the Customer Service Performance Standards and exhibit leadership potential.
Task force participation as requested.
Maintains open lines of communication with providers, medical assistants, and other health center employees, and utilizes a team-based approach to coordinate patient care.
Performs various population-health activities such as patient calls, mailings, assembles patient information packets, etc
May be assigned to work at an additional site temporarily when needed and perform other duties as assigned for adequate patient care EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS REQUIRED
Medical office assistant experience with a minimum of 1 to 2 years experience. AA degree preferred
Certification and/or experience in billing, and coding preferred.
Medical terminology, and automated office experience preferred.
Computer literate required.
Good communication and organizational skills.
Must have personal integrity and be able to work with diverse personalities and under stressful situations.
Ability to work evenings and Saturdays.
